definition: in order to
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
to yearn for sth even in one's dreams (idiom)/to long for sth day and night
diligent and tireless (idiom)

sentences.english: As soon as the scary music kick in, your date  cuddles closer for comfort.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖音樂一開始，你的約會對象就會抱緊你以求安慰。

sentences.english: People put New Year scrolls on the wall for good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 人們把春聯貼到牆上，以求好運。

sentences.english: Transferring the rod having initial bending into the straight rod , its deformation can be com-puted them.
sentences.chinese: 並把具有初彎曲的杆柱轉化爲直杆柱以求其變形。

sentences.english: He spent a lot of money in satisfying the appetite for excitement and amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他花錢如水，以求滿足興奮和歡娛的慾望。

sentences.english: It was powder blue and sleek[1] looking.The kind of car you dream about.
sentences.chinese: 粉藍色的車身閃着光芒，絕對是人們夢寐以求的車。

sentences.english: This bourn is the one that many serious authors go in for.
sentences.chinese: 這是古今中外許多嚴肅的藝術家孜孜以求的藝術境界。

sentences.english: One superpower all psychologists would kill for is the ability to read minds.
sentences.chinese: “讀心術”是每個心理學家都夢寐以求的超能力。

sentences.english: That might help it find a little more of the entrepreneurial vim it craves.
sentences.chinese: 這也許會助其得到一點點其夢寐以求的企業家精神。

sentences.english: People in many countries worshiped special deities intended to protect them from smallpox.
sentences.chinese: 在許多國家，人民祈拜特別神靈以求上天保佑。

sentences.english: A person who lives poor so that he can die rich.
sentences.chinese: 活着過窮日子以求死後富有的人。

sentences.english: We take the conceit in hand, and rub it for good luck.
sentences.chinese: 我們拿起這好感，揩拭它以求好運。

sentences.english: When do you want to buy that dream house?
sentences.chinese: 什麼時候買你夢寐以求的房子？

sentences.english: You are a dream to work with.
sentences.chinese: 能夠與你共事，是我夢寐以求的事情。

sentences.english: The defendant decided to cop a plea in order to get a lighter sentence.
sentences.chinese: 被告人決定認罪以求從輕處理。

sentences.english: Some boys make up to their teachers to get good marks.
sentences.chinese: 有些男孩奉承老師以求獲得高分。

sentences.english: He sent her flowers as a propitiatory gesture.
sentences.chinese: 他將花送給她以求好感。

definition: in order to/hoping to/attempting to/waiting for
so as to/for the purpose of/in order to
to ask for sth and receive it/to try to obtain/to look for and obtain
with this/thereby/thus/because of this
using this as a pretext/thereby
to seek/to look for
using this as a pretext/thereby
can then (and only then)
to try/to make an attempt/to think of a way (to accomplish sth)
lit. thousand ways, a hundred plans (idiom); by every possible means
to think up every possible method (idiom); to devise ways and means/to try this, that and the other
to do one's utmost
to seek after/to strive for
not stint/not spare/not hesitate (to do sth)/not scruple (to do sth)
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
able to/so that sb can/enabling/in order to/finally in a position to/with sth in view
